title: 111_hr6456
content: The "21st Century Civilian Conservation Corps Act" establishes and operates the Civilian Conservation Corps. The Civilian Conservation Corps is established to employ unemployed citizens in public works projects related to forestation, fire prevention, and maintenance of public lands. The Civilian Conservation Corps, established to employ citizens in public works projects related to forestation and public land maintenance, may also work on Federal or State land as determined by the President. Federal agencies like the Department of Labor, Department of Defense, and others can be utilized for CCC operations. The President can extend CCC activities to lands owned by political subdivisions or private owners for specific purposes like preventing forest fires and controlling floods. The President has the authority to enter into contracts with States for carrying out public works related to forestation, controlling floods, and acquiring real property for projects. SEC. 3. ADMINISTRATION OF CIVILIAN CONSERVATION CORPS. The President shall employ additional persons in the Civilian Conservation Corps in order of preference: unemployed veterans of the Armed Forces, unemployed citizens who have exhausted unemployment compensation, those eligible for unemployment compensation, and other citizens seeking employment. The President may provide housing, subsistence, clothing, medical care, and transportation for persons employed in the Civilian Conservation Corps. Non-discrimination in employment is required, except for individuals serving a criminal sentence. Authorization of appropriations for the Civilian Conservation Corps is granted. Authorization of $16 billion for the President to establish and operate a Civilian Conservation Corps for fiscal years 2011-2014. Unobligated funds for public works can be used, with at least 80% allocated for employment under this Act. Exceptions apply to funds for ongoing construction or maintenance of river and harbor projects. Funds allocated for river and harbor improvements under this Act must be used within 90 days of enactment or remain available until expended. The President's authority to establish and operate a Civilian Conservation Corps under this Act will expire on September 30, 2014.
